review.body: LGTM. Only thought: What about adding a `cmake` message along the lines "Consider implementing suitable CPU optimization options function in `src/common/common.c` and contributing back the code" if `OQS_PERMIT_UNSUPPORTED_ARCHITECTURE` is set? That would not be as drastic as outputting such warning as a `printf` in the empty `set_available_cpu_extensions` function.

pull_request.title: Add OQS_PERMIT_UNSUPPORTED_ARCHITECTURE flag
pull_request.body: This PR adds a build flag (`OQS_PERMIT_UNSUPPORTED_ARCHITECTURE`) which bypasses the unsupported architecture error. This should only be used for testing on new architectures.

pull_request.title: Import BIKE Round-3 Additional code
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Import BIKE Round-3 code from the "Additional implementation" available at https://github.com/awslabs/bike-kem.

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->
Addresses  #887

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [x] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

pull_request.title: Remove Picnic's compatibility layer
pull_request.body:
We've had some problems with duplicate symbols being introduced by picnic's OS/libc compatibility layer, which needs:
* aligned_alloc
* aligned_free
* explicit_bzero
* timingsafe_bcmp

We already provide everything except for timingsafe_bcmp in our common code. This PR adds an implementation of "timingsafe_bcmp" (`OQS_MEM_secure_bcmp`) to our common code, and then removes Picnic's compatibility layer.

Resolves #1022
